thread.section_title: WBTV | On Your Side | First Alert Weather | Charlotte, NC
thread.title: Dry, pleasant weekend ahead

author: @WBTV_News
title: Dry, pleasant weekend ahead
text: Chilly mornings, warmer afternoons for the weekend Even colder conditions arrive next week CHARLOTTE, N.C. (WBTV) - High pressure is in control over the region and will keep the Carolinas dry and sunny through the weekend ahead. - Saturday: Morning lows in the 40s, afternoon highs in the upper 70s - Sunday: Low 50s warm into the low 80s by the afternoon, dry - Next Week: Getting even cooler! Clear and calm nights will allow for chilly temperatures for the morning hours, coldest in the mountains, but afternoon sunshine will warm us back into the upper 70s on Saturday. We’ll even reach the low 80s on Sunday in Charlotte. Another cold front then approaches our area, bringing breezy conditions and much colder temperatures our way by the start of next week. Expect morning lows in the low 40s and afternoon highs in the low to mid 60s by mid-week! Stay tuned for frequent forecast updates! Download the free WBTV Weather app on your mobile device, to receive weather alerts and get your latest WBTV weather forecast on the go. You can also get the latest weather forecast on Roku and Amazon Fire’s WBTV app. Have a good weekend! Meteorologist Rachel Coulter Copyright 2024 WBTV. All rights reserved.
